title: Cheap February half term ideas: Family days out from 2 for 1 Disneyland tickets to free museum entry - Mirror Online
text:
4. Kids' cinema tickets from £2 See the hottest animation film releases out this spring for less (Photo: Getty) 
Everyone loves a cheap day out to the cinema, right? Which is why we're feeling pretty smug about spotting these bargain cinema ticket deals, perfectly timed for the school holidays. 
Parents can get £2.49 MyVue tickets for kids aged 2 to 12 years-old as part of the 'mini mornings scheme' that run each weekend at 10am. 
Cineworld also have cheap tickets for kids on selected screenings over the school holidays - and tickets are priced from £2. 
The Odeon also have their own offers with £2.50 tickets for kids - with screenings of Moana, Trolls and The Secret Life of Pets included in the deal.The Odeon also do a special family ticket for four where adults pay child prices, so you can make it a proper family affair on a shoestring budget. 5. Take a family trip to a historic castle for under £20 Explore some of the most picturesque English Heritage attractions (Photo: Rex) 
Ticket normally cover two adult and up to three children, and top attractions include Whitby Abbey in North Yorkshire , Framlingham Castle in Suffolk and Goodrich Castle in Herefordshire . 6. 14% off family ticket to Cadbury World Find yourself in chocolate heaven at Cadbury World in Birmingham 
Experience the real-life chocolate factory with a fun day our to Cadbury World in Bournville, Birminham. 
Take a 3D trip and learn about the history of how chocolate was discovered and bought to Europe, experience the full-scale replica of the first Cadbury shop, opened by John Cadbury in 1824 and then buy your bodyweight in chocolate treats at the world's largest Cadbury shop on site. 
Book a family ticket (for two adults and two kids) from Attractiontix for £49.95 and save 14% off the total price of individual tickets. 7. Get 54% off Ripley's Believe It Or Not Visit the Ripley's 'Peculiar Happenings' show until 5th March 
The special 'Peculiar Happenings' show at Ripley’s runs from 7th February to 5th March 2017. 
The show features an array of odd, inexplicable and bizarre costumes, props and trinkets from the king oddities Tim Burton's film Miss Peregrine’s Home for Peculiar Children. 
The special collection sits alongside the other 700 weird and wonderful artefacts that fill the venue's six floors. 
Groupon currently have tickets for £12.95 - saving you 54% off the normal £27.95 price. 8. Watch a Cirque Du Soleil show, tickets from £20 The Royal Albert Hall hosts Amaluna - the latest Cirque Du Soleil masterpiece - until26th February (Photo: Daily Mirror) 
Adults and kids alike will be captivated by the story of Amaluna - the tale of a castaway romance performed by the acclaimed Cirque Du Soleil. 
Expect dazzling stunts and jaw-dropping performances against the back drop of the impressive Royal Albert Hall in London. 
Get tickets to the show from Lastminute.com until 26th February 2017. 9. Visit a museum for free Get up close to Dolly the Sheep at the National Museum of Scotland (Photo: Getty Images) 
The UK has a wealth of first class museums that offer free access to all for permanent exhibitions. 
We recommend the Merseyside Maritime Museum in Liverpool, Science Museum in London, or the Scottish National Gallery, all of which have an extensive schedule of events, talks and activities scheduled throughout the year. 
If you really need to keep costs down, why not take the kids out for the day at a local museum and pack a homemade picnic to enjoy for lunch? Read More 10. Get a National Trust family membership Take to the great outdoors for some family bonding (Photo: Getty Images) 
Exploring the great outdoors with your family has a number of benefits, the kids stay happy, everyone gets fitter and both kids and adults can learn a great deal about the natural world around them. 
A National Trust family membership can be a really cost effective way to take a large family - the membership is valid for one or two adults and up to 10 children under 17 - to explore picturesque locations across the UK. Like us on Facebook
